content: Hello, my name is Sirui Mu and I'm a student majoring in cybersecurity, mostly working on fuzzing, program analysis and similar stuff. I have been using Rust for over a year on projects such as web servers, fuzzers and utilities and I found it beautiful, and I'm really interested in contributing to rustc.
Hi @Sirui Mu! Have you seen the rustc dev guide? Also what area of the compiler are you interested in contributing to?

Thanks for picking me up @bjorn3 :) I'm currently reading the rustc dev guide and trying to figure out the components and workflow of rustc. I'm interested in contributing to the "backend" of rustc, where analysis on HIR and MIR happen and LLVM IR is emitted.
That would be the issue labels like A-mir, A-llvm and A-codegen.
ok I think I can try to start by picking small issues with these labels
Hi, I am pretty new here, I have been playing with rust for a few months now, just read about the universal SIMD support
We're over in #project-portable-simd and you are quite welcome to join us!
My bad, The UI seemed confusing initially. Starting a topic.
